result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin James Wright Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(Return Address: #720082808, House of Correction, 8885 South 68th Street, Franklin, WI  53132-8202)

Defendant Kevin James Wright in court.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Per the agent's request, case rescheduled for another probation review hearing on 09/16/2016 at 01:30 p.m.
cab
Count one.
Count two.
MEMORANDUM OF CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
PRETRIAL INCARCERATION CREDIT

Defendant Kevin James Wright in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Kevin James Wright in custody.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
As to count 3:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 3 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
As to counts 1 and 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
.
Sentencing continued...
.
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

As to count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 33 days at the House of Correction with 33 days credit.  Time served disposition.  Court found the defendant indigent and waived all costs and surcharges.

As to count 1:
  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for -0- days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  

  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

The parties are here for a jury trial.  The defendant did not initially appear and the court ordered a bench warrant.  The court forfeited the bail.
